===Serial killers===
===Serial killers===
â
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including [[Richard Chase]], [[Ed Gein]], [[Winston Moseley]], [[Dennis Nilsen]], [[John Reginald Halliday Christie]], [[Bruno LÃ¼dke]], [[Jerry Brudos]], [[Gary Ridgway]], [[Ted Bundy]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them (although Dahmer had only confessed to eating the bicep of a male); the technical term for this particular variant activity is [[cannibalism|necrophagia]]. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill [[Jerry Lynn Dean]]. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.
+
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killer]]s, including [[Richard Chase]], [[Ed Gein]], [[Winston Moseley]], [[Dennis Nilsen]], [[John Reginald Halliday Christie]], [[Bruno LÃ¼dke]], [[Jerry Brudos]], [[Gary Ridgway]], [[Stellan Nundoo]], [[Ted Bundy]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them (although Dahmer had only confessed to eating the bicep of a male); the technical term for this particular variant activity is [[cannibalism|necrophagia]]. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill [[Jerry Lynn Dean]]. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.
